Direction: MeNB  en-gNB (Conditional Handover with EN-DC, Conditional PSCell Change), MeNB  SeNB (Conditional Handover with Dual Connectivity)
Direction: eNB  en-gNB or en-gNB  eNB.
Direction: E-UTRAN node1  E-UTRAN node2 (eNB  en-gNB, en-gNB  eNB).
Direction: E-UTRAN node2  E-UTRAN node1 (en-gNB  eNB, eNB  en-gNB).
Direction: E-UTRAN node2  E-UTRAN node1 (en-gNB  eNB, eNB  en-gNB).

Direction: en-gNB  MeNB
Direction: eNB  en-gNB, eNB1  eNB2.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.1.3	Messages for Dual Connectivity Procedures
subsubsections.text_content:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the SeNB to request the preparation of resources for dual connectivity operation for a specific UE
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.



This message is sent by the SeNB to confirm the MeNB about the SeNB addition preparation.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the SeNB to inform the MeNB that the SeNB Addition Preparation has failed.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the SeNB to indicate whether the configuration requested by the SeNB was applied by the UE.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the SeNB to request the preparation to modify SeNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.


This message is sent by the SeNB to confirm the MeNB’s request to modify the SeNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the SeNB to inform the MeNB that the MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation has failed.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the SeNB to the MeNB to request the modification of SeNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the SeNB about the successful modification.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the SeNB that the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification has failed.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the SeNB to request the release of resources.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.


This message is sent by the SeNB to request the release of all resources for a specific UE at the SeNB.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to confirm the release of all resources for a specific UE at the SeNB.
Direction: MeNB  SeNB.


This message is sent by the SeNB to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with SCG bearers established in the SeNB.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.

Direction: SeNB  MeNB.
Direction: SeNB  MeNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.1.4	Messages for E-UTRAN-NR Dual Connectivity Procedures
subsubsections.text_content:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to request the preparation of resources for EN-DC operation for a specific UE
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.



This message is sent by the en-gNB to confirm the MeNB about the SgNB addition preparation.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.



This message is sent by the en-gNB to inform the MeNB that the SgNB Addition Preparation has failed.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to indicate whether the configuration requested by the en-gNB was applied by the UE.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to request the preparation to modify en-gNB resources for a specific UE, to query for the current SCG configuration, or to provide the S-RLF-related information to the en-gNB.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.



This message is sent by the en-gNB to confirm the MeNB’s request to modify the en-gNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.



This message is sent by the en-gNB to inform the MeNB that the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation has failed.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB to request the modification of en-gNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB about the successful modification.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB that the SgNB initiated SgNB Modification has failed.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to request the release of resources.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB to confirme the request to release en-gNB resources.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB to reject the request to release en-gNB resources.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by the en-gNB to request the release of all resources for a specific UE at the en-gNB.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to confirm the release of all resources for a specific UE at the en-gNB.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with the bearers established in the en-gNB.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB to request the change of en-gNB for a specific UE.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB about the successful change.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.


This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB that the SgNB initiated SgNB Change has failed.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.

This message is sent by the en-gNB to report data volumes for secondary RAT.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB

This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB or by the en-gNB to the MeNB to transfer an RRC message.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB or en-gNB  MeNB.

This message is sent by an initiating node to a neighbouring node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to release all the resources for selected UEs.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB, MeNB  en-gNB.


This message is sent by an initiating node to a neighbouring node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to confirm the release all the resources for selected UEs.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB, MeNB  en-gNB.


Direction: eNB  en-gNB, en-gNB  eNB.
This message is sent by a neighbouring eNB to a peer en-gNB or by a neighbouring en-gNB to a peer eNB, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to express the desired resource allocation for data traffic, for the sake of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.


This message is sent by a neighbouring eNB to a peer en-gNB or by a neighbouring en-gNB to a peer eNB, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, as a response to the E-UTRA – NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST.
Direction: eNB  en-gNB, en-gNB  eNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to inform the MeNB that resources for E-RABs controlled by the en-gNB have not been used or are in use again.
Direction: en-gNB  MeNB.


This message is sent by the en-gNB to indicate to the eNB its status of overload.
Direction: en-gNB  eNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to initiate a trace session for a UE.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB

This message is sent by the MeNB to deactivate a trace session.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB

This message is sent by the en-gNB and is used to request the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE Radio Capability ID.
Direction: en-gNB  eNB

This message is sent by the eNB and is used to provide the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE Radio Capability ID indicated in the UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING REQUEST message.
Direction: eNB  en-gNB.

This message is sent by the MeNB to the source en-gNB to inform the cancellation of all of the prepared PSCells in the target en-gNB during a Conditional PSCell Change.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.1.5	Messages for IAB Procedures
subsubsections.text_content:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB or by the MeNB to the en-gNB to transfer the F1-C traffic to and from an IAB-node.
Direction: MeNB  en-gNB or en-gNB  MeNB.

tables.description: Direction: MeNB  en-gNB or en-gNB  MeNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.0	General
9.2.1	GTP Tunnel Endpoint
subsubsections.text_content: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. The QoS Mapping Information is used to set the IP header of packets in case that the en-gNB serves the IAB, and the packets belonging to MN-terminated split bearer/SCG bearer are transmitted from MeNB to en-gNB.

tables.description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. The QoS Mapping Information is used to set the IP header of packets in case that the en-gNB serves the IAB, and the packets belonging to MN-terminated split bearer/SCG bearer are transmitted from MeNB to en-gNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.2	Trace Activation
subsubsections.text_content: Defines parameters related to trace activation.

tables.description: Defines parameters related to trace activation.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.3	Handover Restriction List
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation.

tables.description: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.4	PLMN Identity
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity.

tables.description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.5	DL Forwarding
subsubsections.text_content: This element indicates that the E-RAB is proposed for forwarding of downlink packets.

tables.description: This element indicates that the E-RAB is proposed for forwarding of downlink packets.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.6	Cause
subsubsections.text_content:
The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

The meaning of the different cause values is described in the following table. In general, "not supported" cause values indicate that the concerned capability is missing. On the other hand, "not available" cause values indicate that the concerned capability is present, but insufficient resources were available to perform the requested action.

tables.description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

The meaning of the different cause values is described in the following table. In general, "not supported" cause values indicate that the concerned capability is missing. On the other hand, "not available" cause values indicate that the concerned capability is present, but insufficient resources were available to perform the requested action.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.7	Criticality Diagnostics
subsubsections.text_content: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

tables.description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.8	Served Cell Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.

tables.description: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.9	E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.

tables.description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.10	GBR QoS Information
subsubsections.text_content:
This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink.
NOTE:	For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

tables.description: NOTE:	For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.11	Bit Rate
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

tables.description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.12	UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
subsubsections.text_content: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

tables.description: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.13	Message Type
subsubsections.text_content: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

tables.description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.14	ECGI
subsubsections.text_content: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

tables.description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.15	COUNT Value
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates the 12 bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number.

tables.description: This information element indicates the 12 bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.16	GUMMEI
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates the globally unique MME identity.

tables.description: This information element indicates the globally unique MME identity.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.17	UL Interference Overload Indication
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides, per PRB, a report on interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.

tables.description: This IE provides, per PRB, a report on interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.18	UL High Interference Indication
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides, per PRB, a 2 level report on interference sensitivity. The interaction between the indication of UL Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.

tables.description: This IE provides, per PRB, a 2 level report on interference sensitivity. The interaction between the indication of UL Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.19	Relative Narrowband Tx Power (RNTP)
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides an indication on DL power restriction per PRB or per subframe per PRB (Enhanced RNTP) in a cell and other information needed by a neighbour eNB for interference aware scheduling.

tables.description: This IE provides an indication on DL power restriction per PRB or per subframe per PRB (Enhanced RNTP) in a cell and other information needed by a neighbour eNB for interference aware scheduling.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.20	GU Group Id
subsubsections.text_content: The GU Group Id IE is the globally unique group id corresponding to a pool area.

tables.description: The GU Group Id IE is the globally unique group id corresponding to a pool area.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.21	Location Reporting Information
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported.

tables.description: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.22	Global eNB ID
subsubsections.text_content: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

tables.description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.23	E-RAB ID
subsubsections.text_content: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

tables.description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.24	eNB UE X2AP ID
subsubsections.text_content:
This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB.
The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2].
NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

tables.description: NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.25	Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
subsubsections.text_content: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]).

tables.description: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.25a	Additional RRM Policy Index
subsubsections.text_content: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

tables.description: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.26	EARFCN
subsubsections.text_content: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

tables.description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.27	Transmission Bandwidth
subsubsections.text_content: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

tables.description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.28	E-RAB List
subsubsections.text_content: The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate not admitted bearers.

tables.description: The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate not admitted bearers.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.29	UE Security Capabilities
subsubsections.text_content: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE. The eNBs store and send the complete bitmaps without modification or truncation as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

tables.description: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE. The eNBs store and send the complete bitmaps without modification or truncation as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.30	AS Security Information
subsubsections.text_content: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.

tables.description: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.31	Allocation and Retention Priority
subsubsections.text_content: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

tables.description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.32	Time To Wait
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

tables.description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.33	SRVCC Operation Possible
subsubsections.text_content: The IE indicates that both the UE and the MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour on reception of this is specified in TS 23.216 [20].

tables.description: The IE indicates that both the UE and the MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour on reception of this is specified in TS 23.216 [20].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.34	Hardware Load Indicator
subsubsections.text_content: The Hardware Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the Hardware Load experienced by the cell.

tables.description: The Hardware Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the Hardware Load experienced by the cell.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.35	S1 TNL Load Indicator
subsubsections.text_content: The S1 TNL Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the S1 Transport Network Load experienced by the cell.

tables.description: The S1 TNL Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the S1 Transport Network Load experienced by the cell.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.36	Load Indicator
subsubsections.text_content: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.

tables.description: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.37	Radio Resource Status
subsubsections.text_content: The Radio Resource Status IE indicates the usage of the PRBs for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink (TS 36.314 [22], TS 23.203 [13]) and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling.

tables.description: The Radio Resource Status IE indicates the usage of the PRBs for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink (TS 36.314 [22], TS 23.203 [13]) and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.38	UE History Information
subsubsections.text_content:
The UE History Information IE contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [15].
NOTE:	The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 36.413 [4].

tables.description: NOTE:	The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 36.413 [4].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.39	Last Visited Cell Information
subsubsections.text_content: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.

tables.description: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.40	Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
subsubsections.text_content: The Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information contains information about a cell that is to be used for RRM purposes.

tables.description: The Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information contains information about a cell that is to be used for RRM purposes.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.41	Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
subsubsections.text_content:
The Last Visited Cell Information for GERAN is currently undefined.
NOTE:	If in later Releases this is defined, the choice type may be extended with the actual GERAN specific information.

tables.description: NOTE:	If in later Releases this is defined, the choice type may be extended with the actual GERAN specific information.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.42	Cell Type
subsubsections.text_content: The cell type provides the cell coverage area.

tables.description: The cell type provides the cell coverage area.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.43	Number of Antenna Ports
subsubsections.text_content: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports.

tables.description: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.44	Composite Available Capacity Group
subsubsections.text_content: The Composite Available Capacity Group IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in Downlink and Uplink.

tables.description: The Composite Available Capacity Group IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in Downlink and Uplink.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.45	Composite Available Capacity
subsubsections.text_content: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

tables.description: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.46	Cell Capacity Class Value
subsubsections.text_content: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes.

tables.description: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.47	Capacity Value
subsubsections.text_content: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available.

tables.description: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.48	Mobility Parameters Information
subsubsections.text_content: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later.

tables.description: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.49	Mobility Parameters Modification Range
subsubsections.text_content: The Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values permitted by the eNB2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent.

tables.description: The Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values permitted by the eNB2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.50	PRACH Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.

tables.description: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.51	Subframe Allocation
subsubsections.text_content: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].

tables.description: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.52	CSG Membership Status
subsubsections.text_content: This element indicates the membership status of the UE to a particular CSG.

tables.description: This element indicates the membership status of the UE to a particular CSG.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.53	CSG ID
subsubsections.text_content: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.

tables.description: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.54	ABS Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides information about which sub frames the sending eNB is configuring as almost blank subframes and which subset of almost blank subframes are recommended for configuring measurements towards the UE. Almost blank subframes are subframes with reduced power on some physical channels and/or reduced activity.

tables.description: This IE provides information about which sub frames the sending eNB is configuring as almost blank subframes and which subset of almost blank subframes are recommended for configuring measurements towards the UE. Almost blank subframes are subframes with reduced power on some physical channels and/or reduced activity.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.55	Invoke Indication
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides an indication about which type of information the sending eNB would like the receiving eNB to send back.

tables.description: This IE provides an indication about which type of information the sending eNB would like the receiving eNB to send back.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.56	MDT Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: The IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.

tables.description: The IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.58	ABS Status
subsubsections.text_content: The ABS Status IE is used to aid the eNB designating ABS to evaluate the need for modification of the ABS pattern.

tables.description: The ABS Status IE is used to aid the eNB designating ABS to evaluate the need for modification of the ABS pattern.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.59	Management Based MDT Allowed
subsubsections.text_content: This information element is used by the eNB to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [6].

tables.description: This information element is used by the eNB to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [6].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.60	MultibandInfoList
subsubsections.text_content: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].

tables.description: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.61	M3 Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

tables.description: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.62	M4 Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

tables.description: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.63	M5 Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

tables.description: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.64	MDT PLMN List
subsubsections.text_content: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

tables.description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.65	EARFCN Extension
subsubsections.text_content: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

tables.description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.66	COUNT Value Extended
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

tables.description: This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.67	Extended UL Interference Overload Info
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides report on interference overload for the set of subframes that are subject to UL-DL subframe reconfiguration. This IE applies to TDD only.

tables.description: This IE provides report on interference overload for the set of subframes that are subject to UL-DL subframe reconfiguration. This IE applies to TDD only.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.68	RNL Header
subsubsections.text_content: The RNL Header IE indicates the target eNB ID and source eNB ID.

tables.description: The RNL Header IE indicates the target eNB ID and source eNB ID.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.69	Masked IMEISV
subsubsections.text_content: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

tables.description: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.70	Expected UE Behaviour
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time.

tables.description: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.71	Expected UE Activity Behaviour
subsubsections.text_content: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].

tables.description: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.72	SeNB Security Key
subsubsections.text_content: The SeNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the SeNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

tables.description: The SeNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the SeNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.73	SCG Change Indication
subsubsections.text_content: The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]).

tables.description: The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.74	CoMP Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides the list of CoMP hypothesis sets, where each CoMP hypothesis set is the collection of CoMP hypothesis(es) of one or multiple cells and each CoMP hypothesis set is associated with a benefit metric.

tables.description: This IE provides the list of CoMP hypothesis sets, where each CoMP hypothesis set is the collection of CoMP hypothesis(es) of one or multiple cells and each CoMP hypothesis set is associated with a benefit metric.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.75	CoMP Hypothesis Set
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides a set of CoMP hypotheses. A CoMP hypothesis is hypothetical PRB-specific resource allocation information for a cell.

tables.description: This IE provides a set of CoMP hypotheses. A CoMP hypothesis is hypothetical PRB-specific resource allocation information for a cell.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.76	RSRP Measurement Report List
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides RSRP measurement reports of UEs served by the sending eNB.

tables.description: This IE provides RSRP measurement reports of UEs served by the sending eNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.77	Dynamic DL transmission information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains assistance information for DL interference mitigation.

tables.description: This IE contains assistance information for DL interference mitigation.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.78	ProSe Authorized
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s).

tables.description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.79	CSI Report
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides CSI reports of UEs served by the cell for which the information is provided.

tables.description: This IE provides CSI reports of UEs served by the cell for which the information is provided.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.80	Wideband CQI
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].

tables.description: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.81	Subband CQI
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].

tables.description: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.82	COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
subsubsections.text_content: This information element indicates the 18 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

tables.description: This information element indicates the 18 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.83	LHN ID
subsubsections.text_content: The LHN ID IE is used to indicate the LHN ID of the eNB, as defined in TS 23.003 [29].

tables.description: The LHN ID IE is used to indicate the LHN ID of the eNB, as defined in TS 23.003 [29].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.84	Correlation ID
subsubsections.text_content: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE key to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the L-GW described in TS 23.401 [12].

tables.description: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE key to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the L-GW described in TS 23.401 [12].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.85	UE Context Kept Indicator
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32].

tables.description: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.86	eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
subsubsections.text_content:
This information element combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. If the setup of an UE associcated signalling connection was initiated including the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension shall be used by both peers for the life-time of the respective UE-associated signalling connection.
The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2].
NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

tables.description: NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.87	M6 Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.

tables.description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.88	M7 Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.

tables.description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.89	Tunnel Information
subsubsections.text_content: The Tunnel Information IE indicates the transport layer address and UDP port number.

tables.description: The Tunnel Information IE indicates the transport layer address and UDP port number.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.90	X2 Benefit Value
subsubsections.text_content: The X2 Benefit Value IE indicates the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.

tables.description: The X2 Benefit Value IE indicates the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.91	Resume ID
subsubsections.text_content: The Resume ID IE is used to address a suspended UE Context within an eNB.

tables.description: The Resume ID IE is used to address a suspended UE Context within an eNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.92	Bearer Type
subsubsections.text_content: This IE is used to support Non-IP data as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

tables.description: This IE is used to support Non-IP data as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.93	V2X Services Authorized
subsubsections.text_content: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE to use the sidelink for V2X services.

tables.description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE to use the sidelink for V2X services.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.94	Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN
subsubsections.text_content: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

tables.description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.95	WT ID
subsubsections.text_content: This IE is used to identify a WT.

tables.description: This IE is used to identify a WT.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.96	WT UE XwAP ID
subsubsections.text_content: The WT UE XwAP ID is allocated by the WT and uniquely identifies a UE over the Xw interface.

tables.description: The WT UE XwAP ID is allocated by the WT and uniquely identifies a UE over the Xw interface.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.97	UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the aggregate maximum bit rate for all radio bearers per UE in the sidelink for V2X services.

tables.description: This IE indicates the aggregate maximum bit rate for all radio bearers per UE in the sidelink for V2X services.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.98	NR Neighbour Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.

tables.description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.99	Extended Bit Rate
subsubsections.text_content: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

tables.description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.100	en-gNB UE X2AP ID
subsubsections.text_content:
This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB.
The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2].
NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

tables.description: NOTE: 	If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.101	SgNB Security Key
subsubsections.text_content: The SgNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the en-gNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

tables.description: The SgNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the en-gNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.102	Target SgNB ID Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains the target SgNB ID used by MeNB to find the target en-gNB.

tables.description: This IE contains the target SgNB ID used by MeNB to find the target en-gNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.103	SCG Configuration Query
subsubsections.text_content: The SCG Configuration Query IE is used to request the en-gNB to provide current SCG configuration.

tables.description: The SCG Configuration Query IE is used to request the en-gNB to provide current SCG configuration.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.104	Delivery Status
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the Delivery Status IE of RRC Transfer message.

tables.description: This IE defines the Delivery Status IE of RRC Transfer message.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.105	Void
subsubsections.text_content: Void

subsubsections.title: 9.2.106	NR Frequency Info
subsubsections.text_content: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

tables.description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.107	NR UE Security Capabilities
subsubsections.text_content: This IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in NR as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. The eNBs store and send the complete bitmaps without modification or truncation as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

tables.description: This IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in NR as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. The eNBs store and send the complete bitmaps without modification or truncation as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

subsubsections.title: 9.2.108	EN-DC Resource Configuration
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG.

tables.description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.109	PDCP Change Indication
subsubsections.text_content: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used to require the MeNB to either initiate the security key update or to perform PDCP data recovery towards the UE (see TS 37.340 [15]).

tables.description: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used to require the MeNB to either initiate the security key update or to perform PDCP data recovery towards the UE (see TS 37.340 [15]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.110	Served NR Cell Information
subsubsections.text_content: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.

tables.description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.111	NR CGI
subsubsections.text_content: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

tables.description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.112	Global en-gNB ID
subsubsections.text_content: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

tables.description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

subsubsections.title: 9.2.113	Void
subsubsections.text_content: Void.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.114	NR Transmission Bandwidth
subsubsections.text_content: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.

subsubsections.text_content: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.116	MeNB Resource Coordination Information
subsubsections.text_content: The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to coordinate resource or sidelink resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB.

subsubsections.title: 9.2.117	SgNB Resource Coordination Information
subsubsections.text_content: The SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the PCell which are not available for use by the MeNB and is used at the MeNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

subsubsections.text_content: The NR Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources per cell and per SSB area that are available relative to the total en-gNB resources. The NR Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available.

The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum en-gNB resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The NR Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available.

subsections.title: 9.3	Message and Information Element Abstract Syntax (with ASN.1)

subsubsections.title: 9.3.1	General
subsubsections.text_content:
X2AP ASN.1 definition conforms to ITU-T Rec. X.680 [27] and ITU-T Rec. X.681 [28].
Sub clause 9.3 presents the Abstract Syntax of the X2AP protocol with ASN.1. In case there is contradiction between the ASN.1 definition in this sub clause and the tabular format in sub clause 9.1 and 9.2, the ASN.1 shall take precedence, except for the definition of conditions for the presence of conditional elements, in which the tabular format shall take precedence.
The ASN.1 definition specifies the structure and content of X2AP messages. X2AP messages can contain any IEs specified in the object set definitions for that message without the order or number of occurrence being restricted by ASN.1. However, for this version of the standard, a sending entity shall construct an X2AP message according to the PDU definitions module and with the following additional rules:
-	IEs shall be ordered (in an IE container) in the order they appear in object set definitions.
-	Object set definitions specify how many times IEs may appear. An IE shall appear exactly once if the presence field in an object has value "mandatory". An IE may appear at most once if the presence field in an object has value "optional" or "conditional". If in a tabular format there is multiplicity specified for an IE (i.e. an IE list) then in the corresponding ASN.1 definition the list definition is separated into two parts. The first part defines an IE container list in which the list elements reside. The second part defines list elements. The IE container list appears as an IE of its own. For this version of the standard an IE container list may contain only one kind of list elements.
NOTE:	In the above, "IE" means an IE in the object set with an explicit ID. If one IE needs to appear more than once in one object set, then the different occurrences have different IE IDs.
If an X2AP message that is not constructed as defined above is received, this shall be considered as Abstract Syntax Error, and the message shall be handled as defined for Abstract Syntax Error in clause 10.

subsubsections.title: 9.3.2	Usage of Private Message Mechanism for Non-standard Use
subsubsections.text_content:
The private message mechanism for non-standard use may be used:
-	for special operator (and/or vendor) specific features considered not to be part of the basic functionality, i.e. the functionality required for a complete and high-quality specification in order to guarantee multivendor inter-operability.
-	by vendors for research purposes, e.g. to implement and evaluate new algorithms/features before such features are proposed for standardisation.
The private message mechanism shall not be used for basic functionality. Such functionality shall be standardised.

subsubsections.title: 9.3.3	Elementary Procedure Definitions
subsubsections.text_content:

FROM X2AP-Constants;

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Interface Elementary Procedure Class
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE ::= CLASS {
&InitiatingMessage				,
&SuccessfulOutcome				OPTIONAL,
&UnsuccessfulOutcome				OPTIONAL,
&procedureCode			ProcedureCode 	UNIQUE,
&criticality			Criticality 	DEFAULT ignore
}
WITH SYNTAX {
INITIATING MESSAGE		&InitiatingMessage
[SUCCESSFUL OUTCOME		&SuccessfulOutcome]
[UNSUCCESSFUL OUTCOME		&UnsuccessfulOutcome]
PROCEDURE CODE			&procedureCode
[CRITICALITY			&criticality]
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Interface PDU Definition
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-PDU ::= CHOICE {
initiatingMessage	InitiatingMessage,
successfulOutcome	SuccessfulOutcome,
unsuccessfulOutcome	UnsuccessfulOutcome,
...
}

InitiatingMessage ::= SEQUENCE {
procedureCode	X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&procedureCode		({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}),
criticality		X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&criticality			({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode}),
value			X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&InitiatingMessage	({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode})
}

SuccessfulOutcome ::= SEQUENCE {
procedureCode	X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&procedureCode		({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}),
criticality		X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&criticality			({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode}),
value			X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&SuccessfulOutcome	({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode})
}

UnsuccessfulOutcome ::= SEQUENCE {
procedureCode	X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&procedureCode		({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}),
criticality		X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&criticality			({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode}),
value			X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE.&UnsuccessfulOutcome	({X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES}{@procedureCode})
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Interface Elementary Procedure List
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE ::= {
X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES-CLASS-1			|
X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES-CLASS-2			,
...
}

X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES-CLASS-1 X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE ::= {
handoverPreparation										|
reset													|
x2Setup													|
resourceStatusReportingInitiation						|
eNBConfigurationUpdate									|
mobilitySettingsChange									|
cellActivation											|
seNBAdditionPreparation									|
meNBinitiatedSeNBModificationPreparation				|
seNBinitiatedSeNBModification							|
seNBinitiatedSeNBRelease								|
x2Removal												|
retrieveUEContext										|
sgNBAdditionPreparation									|
meNBinitiatedSgNBModificationPreparation				|
sgNBinitiatedSgNBModification							|
meNBinitiatedSgNBRelease								|
sgNBinitiatedSgNBRelease								|
sgNBChange												|
endcX2Setup												|
endcConfigurationUpdate									|
endcCellActivation										|
endcPartialReset										|
eUTRANRCellResourceCoordination							|
endcX2Removal											|
endcresourceStatusReportingInitiation					|
uERadioCapabilityIDMapping								,
...
}

X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURES-CLASS-2 X2AP-ELEMENTARY-PROCEDURE ::= {
snStatusTransfer						|
uEContextRelease						|
handoverCancel							|
errorIndication							|
resourceStatusReporting					|
loadIndication							|
privateMessage							|

handoverReport							|
x2Release								|
x2APMessageTransfer						|
seNBReconfigurationCompletion			|

seNBCounterCheck						|

sgNBCounterCheck						|
rRCTransfer								|
secondaryRATDataUsageReport				|
sgNBActivityNotification				|
dataForwardingAddressIndication			|
gNBStatusIndication						|
endcConfigurationTransfer				|
deactivateTrace							|
traceStart								|
handoverSuccess							|
earlyStatusTransfer						|
conditionalHandoverCancel				|
endcresourceStatusReporting				|
cellTrafficTrace						|
f1CTrafficTransfer						|
accessAndMobilityIndication				|
cPC-cancel								|
rachIndication							,
...

}

FROM X2AP-Constants;

-- **************************************************************
--
-- HANDOVER REQUEST
--
-- **************************************************************

HandoverRequest ::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs			ProtocolIE-Container	{{HandoverRequest-IEs}},
...
}

HandoverRequest-IEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-Old-eNB-UE-X2AP-ID							CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID												PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-Cause										CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE Cause													PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-TargetCell-ID								CRITICALITY reject	TYPE ECGI													PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-GUMMEI-ID									CRITICALITY reject	TYPE GUMMEI													PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-UE-ContextInformation						CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-ContextInformation								PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-UE-HistoryInformation						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-HistoryInformation								PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-TraceActivation								CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE TraceActivation										PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-SRVCCOperationPossible						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE SRVCCOperationPossible								PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-CSGMembershipStatus							CRITICALITY reject	TYPE CSGMembershipStatus									PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-MobilityInformation							CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE MobilityInformation									PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Masked-IMEISV								CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE Masked-IMEISV											PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-UE-HistoryInformationFromTheUE				CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-HistoryInformationFromTheUE					PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-ExpectedUEBehaviour							CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE ExpectedUEBehaviour									PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-ProSeAuthorized								CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE ProSeAuthorized										PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-UE-ContextReferenceAtSeNB					CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-ContextReferenceAtSeNB							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Old-eNB-UE-X2AP-ID-Extension				CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID-Extension								PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-V2XServicesAuthorized						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE V2XServicesAuthorized								PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-UE-ContextReferenceAtWT						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-ContextReferenceAtWT							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-NRUESecurityCapabilities					CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE NRUESecurityCapabilities							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-UE-ContextReferenceAtSgNB					CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-ContextReferenceAtSgNB							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-AerialUEsubscriptionInformation				CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE AerialUEsubscriptionInformation					PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Subscription-Based-UE-DifferentiationInfo	CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE Subscription-Based-UE-DifferentiationInfo	PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-CHOinformation-REQ							CRITICALITY reject	TYPE CHOinformation-REQ									PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-NRV2XServicesAuthorized						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE NRV2XServicesAuthorized							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-PC5QoSParameters							CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE PC5QoSParameters										PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-IABNodeIndication							CRITICALITY reject	TYPE IABNodeIndication									PRESENCE optional},
...
}

UE-ContextInformation ::= SEQUENCE {
mME-UE-S1AP-ID						UE-S1AP-ID,
uESecurityCapabilities				UESecurityCapabilities,
aS-SecurityInformation				AS-SecurityInformation,
uEaggregateMaximumBitRate			UEAggregateMaximumBitRate,
subscriberProfileIDforRFP			SubscriberProfileIDforRFP		OPTIONAL,
e-RABs-ToBeSetup-List				E-RABs-ToBeSetup-List,
rRC-Context							RRC-Context,
handoverRestrictionList				HandoverRestrictionList		OPTIONAL,
locationReportingInformation		LocationReportingInformation	OPTIONAL,
iE-Extensions						ProtocolExtensionContainer { {UE-ContextInformation-ExtIEs} } OPTIONAL,
...
}

UE-ContextInformation-ExtIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= {
{ ID id-ManagementBasedMDTallowed			CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION ManagementBasedMDTallowed					PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-ManagementBasedMDTPLMNList			CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION MDTPLMNList									PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-UESidelinkAggregateMaximumBitRate	CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION UESidelinkAggregateMaximumBitRate		PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-EPCHandoverRestrictionListContainer CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION EPCHandoverRestrictionListContainer		PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-AdditionalRRMPriorityIndex			CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION AdditionalRRMPriorityIndex					PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-NRUESidelinkAggregateMaximumBitRate	CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION NRUESidelinkAggregateMaximumBitRate		PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-UERadioCapabilityID					CRITICALITY reject	EXTENSION UERadioCapabilityID							PRESENCE optional }|
{ ID id-IMSvoiceEPSfallbackfrom5G			CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION IMSvoiceEPSfallbackfrom5G					PRESENCE optional},
...
}

E-RABs-ToBeSetup-List ::= SEQUENCE (SIZE(1..maxnoofBearers)) OF ProtocolIE-Single-Container { {E-RABs-ToBeSetup-ItemIEs} }

E-RABs-ToBeSetup-ItemIEs 	X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-E-RABs-ToBeSetup-Item	 CRITICALITY ignore 	TYPE E-RABs-ToBeSetup-Item 	PRESENCE mandatory },
...
}

E-RABs-ToBeSetup-Item ::= SEQUENCE {
e-RAB-ID					E-RAB-ID,
e-RAB-Level-QoS-Parameters		E-RAB-Level-QoS-Parameters,
dL-Forwarding					DL-Forwarding													OPTIONAL,
uL-GTPtunnelEndpoint			GTPtunnelEndpoint,
iE-Extensions					ProtocolExtensionContainer { {E-RABs-ToBeSetup-ItemExtIEs} } OPTIONAL,
...
}

E-RABs-ToBeSetup-ItemExtIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= {
{ ID id-BearerType		CRITICALITY reject	EXTENSION BearerType		PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-DAPSRequestInfo		CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION DAPSRequestInfo			PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Ethernet-Type	CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION Ethernet-Type		PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-SourceDLForwardingIPAddress			CRITICALITY ignore	EXTENSION TransportLayerAddress		PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-SecurityIndication	CRITICALITY reject	EXTENSION SecurityIndication				PRESENCE optional},
...
}

MobilityInformation ::= BIT STRING (SIZE(32))

SourceDLForwardingIPAddress ::= BIT STRING (SIZE(1..160, ...))


UE-ContextReferenceAtSeNB ::= SEQUENCE {
source-GlobalSeNB-ID		GlobalENB-ID,
seNB-UE-X2AP-ID				UE-X2AP-ID,
seNB-UE-X2AP-ID-Extension	UE-X2AP-ID-Extension,
iE-Extensions				ProtocolExtensionContainer { {UE-ContextReferenceAtSeNB-ItemExtIEs} } OPTIONAL,
...
}

UE-ContextReferenceAtSeNB-ItemExtIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= {
...
}

UE-ContextReferenceAtWT ::= SEQUENCE {
wTID					WTID,
wT-UE-XwAP-ID			WT-UE-XwAP-ID,
iE-Extensions			ProtocolExtensionContainer { {UE-ContextReferenceAtWT-ItemExtIEs} } OPTIONAL,
...
}

UE-ContextReferenceAtWT-ItemExtIEs	X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= {
...
}

UE-ContextReferenceAtSgNB ::= SEQUENCE {
source-GlobalSgNB-ID			GlobalGNB-ID,
sgNB-UE-X2AP-ID				SgNB-UE-X2AP-ID,
iE-Extensions				ProtocolExtensionContainer { {UE-ContextReferenceAtSgNB-ItemExtIEs} } OPTIONAL,
...
}

UE-ContextReferenceAtSgNB-ItemExtIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= {
...
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
--
-- **************************************************************

HandoverRequestAcknowledge ::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs		ProtocolIE-Container	{{HandoverRequestAcknowledge-IEs}},
...
}

HandoverRequestAcknowledge-IEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-Old-eNB-UE-X2AP-ID							CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID		PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-New-eNB-UE-X2AP-ID							CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID		PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-E-RABs-Admitted-List						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE E-RABs-Admitted-List	PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-E-RABs-NotAdmitted-List						CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE E-RAB-List		PRESENCE optional}|

{ ID id-SgNB-UE-X2AP-ID						CRITICALITY reject	TYPE SgNB-UE-X2AP-ID				PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-F1CTrafficContainer					CRITICALITY reject	TYPE F1CTrafficContainer			PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-MeNB-UE-X2AP-ID-Extension			CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID-Extension			PRESENCE optional},
...
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING REQUEST
--
-- **************************************************************

UERadioCapabilityIDMappingRequest::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs			ProtocolIE-Container       { { UERadioCapabilityIDMappingRequestIEs} },
...
}

UERadioCapabilityIDMappingRequestIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-UERadioCapabilityID		CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UERadioCapabilityID		PRESENCE mandatory	},
...
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING RESPONSE
--
-- **************************************************************

UERadioCapabilityIDMappingResponse ::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs			ProtocolIE-Container       { { UERadioCapabilityIDMappingResponseIEs} },
...
}

UERadioCapabilityIDMappingResponseIEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-UERadioCapabilityID				CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UERadioCapabilityID			PRESENCE mandatory }|
{ ID id-UERadioCapability				CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE UERadioCapability				PRESENCE mandatory }|
{ ID id-CriticalityDiagnostics			CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE CriticalityDiagnostics			PRESENCE optional  },
...
}


-- **************************************************************
--
-- CONDITIONAL PSCELL CHANGE CANCEL
--
-- **************************************************************

CPC-cancel ::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs		ProtocolIE-Container		{{CPC-cancel-IEs}},
...
}

CPC-cancel-IEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-MeNB-UE-X2AP-ID						CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID						PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-SgNB-UE-X2AP-ID						CRITICALITY reject	TYPE SgNB-UE-X2AP-ID				PRESENCE mandatory}|
{ ID id-MeNB-UE-X2AP-ID-Extension			CRITICALITY reject	TYPE UE-X2AP-ID-Extension			PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Cause								CRITICALITY ignore	TYPE Cause							PRESENCE optional}|
{ ID id-Target-SgNB-ID						CRITICALITY reject	TYPE GlobalGNB-ID					PRESENCE mandatory},
...
}


-- **************************************************************
--
-- RACH INDICATION
--
-- **************************************************************

RachIndication ::= SEQUENCE {
protocolIEs			ProtocolIE-Container	{{ RachIndication-IEs}},
...
}

RachIndication-IEs X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= {
{ ID id-RaReportIndicationList				CRITICALITY reject		TYPE RaReportIndicationList							PRESENCE mandatory },
...
}

subsubsections.title: 9.3.8	Container definitions
subsubsections.text_content:
-- ASN1START
-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container definitions
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-Containers {
itu-t (0) identified-organization (4) etsi (0) mobileDomain (0)
eps-Access (21) modules (3) x2ap (2) version1 (1) x2ap-Containers (5) }

DEFINITIONS AUTOMATIC TAGS ::=

BEGIN

-- **************************************************************
--
-- IE parameter types from other modules.
--
-- **************************************************************

IMPORTS
maxPrivateIEs,
maxProtocolExtensions,
maxProtocolIEs,
Criticality,
Presence,
PrivateIE-ID,
ProtocolIE-ID
FROM X2AP-CommonDataTypes;

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Class Definition for Protocol IEs
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES ::= CLASS {
&id				ProtocolIE-ID 			UNIQUE,
&criticality	Criticality,
&Value,
&presence		Presence
}
WITH SYNTAX {
ID				&id
CRITICALITY		&criticality
TYPE			&Value
PRESENCE		&presence
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Class Definition for Protocol IEs
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR ::= CLASS {
&id						ProtocolIE-ID 		UNIQUE,
&firstCriticality		Criticality,
&FirstValue,
&secondCriticality		Criticality,
&SecondValue,
&presence				Presence
}
WITH SYNTAX {
ID						&id
FIRST CRITICALITY 		&firstCriticality
FIRST TYPE				&FirstValue
SECOND CRITICALITY 		&secondCriticality
SECOND TYPE				&SecondValue
PRESENCE				&presence
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Class Definition for Protocol Extensions
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION ::= CLASS {
&id					ProtocolIE-ID 		UNIQUE,
&criticality		Criticality,
&Extension,
&presence			Presence
}
WITH SYNTAX {
ID					&id
CRITICALITY			&criticality
EXTENSION			&Extension
PRESENCE			&presence
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Class Definition for Private IEs
--
-- **************************************************************

X2AP-PRIVATE-IES ::= CLASS {
&id					PrivateIE-ID,
&criticality		Criticality,
&Value,
&presence			Presence
}
WITH SYNTAX {
ID					&id
CRITICALITY			&criticality
TYPE				&Value
PRESENCE			&presence
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container for Protocol IEs
--
-- **************************************************************

ProtocolIE-Container {X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES : IEsSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (0..maxProtocolIEs)) OF
ProtocolIE-Field {{IEsSetParam}}

ProtocolIE-Single-Container {X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES : IEsSetParam} ::=
ProtocolIE-Field {{IEsSetParam}}

ProtocolIE-Field {X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES : IEsSetParam} ::= SEQUENCE {
id				X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES.&id					({IEsSetParam}),
criticality		X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES.&criticality			({IEsSetParam}{@id}),
value			X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES.&Value				({IEsSetParam}{@id})
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container for Protocol IE Pairs
--
-- **************************************************************

ProtocolIE-ContainerPair {X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR : IEsSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (0..maxProtocolIEs)) OF
ProtocolIE-FieldPair {{IEsSetParam}}

ProtocolIE-FieldPair {X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR : IEsSetParam} ::= SEQUENCE {
id					X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR.&id					({IEsSetParam}),
firstCriticality	X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR.&firstCriticality	({IEsSetParam}{@id}),
firstValue			X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR.&FirstValue			({IEsSetParam}{@id}),
secondCriticality	X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR.&secondCriticality	({IEsSetParam}{@id}),
secondValue			X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR.&SecondValue			({IEsSetParam}{@id})
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container Lists for Protocol IE Containers
--
-- **************************************************************

ProtocolIE-ContainerList {INTEGER : lowerBound, INTEGER : upperBound, X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES : IEsSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (lowerBound..upperBound)) OF
ProtocolIE-Container {{IEsSetParam}}

ProtocolIE-ContainerPairList {INTEGER : lowerBound, INTEGER : upperBound, X2AP-PROTOCOL-IES-PAIR : IEsSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (lowerBound..upperBound)) OF
ProtocolIE-ContainerPair {{IEsSetParam}}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container for Protocol Extensions
--
-- **************************************************************

ProtocolExtensionContainer {X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION : ExtensionSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (1..maxProtocolExtensions)) OF
ProtocolExtensionField {{ExtensionSetParam}}

ProtocolExtensionField {X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION : ExtensionSetParam} ::= SEQUENCE {
id					X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION.&id				({ExtensionSetParam}),
criticality			X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION.&criticality	({ExtensionSetParam}{@id}),
extensionValue		X2AP-PROTOCOL-EXTENSION.&Extension		({ExtensionSetParam}{@id})
}

-- **************************************************************
--
-- Container for Private IEs
--
-- **************************************************************

PrivateIE-Container {X2AP-PRIVATE-IES : IEsSetParam} ::=
SEQUENCE (SIZE (1..maxPrivateIEs)) OF
PrivateIE-Field {{IEsSetParam}}

PrivateIE-Field {X2AP-PRIVATE-IES : IEsSetParam} ::= SEQUENCE {
id				X2AP-PRIVATE-IES.&id			({IEsSetParam}),
criticality		X2AP-PRIVATE-IES.&criticality	({IEsSetParam}{@id}),
value			X2AP-PRIVATE-IES.&Value			({IEsSetParam}{@id})
}

END
-- ASN1STOP

subsections.title: 9.4	Message transfer syntax
subsections.text_content: X2AP shall use the ASN.1 Basic Packed Encoding Rules (BASIC-PER) Aligned Variant as transfer syntax, as specified in ITU-T Rec. X.691 [5].

subsections.title: 9.5	Timers
subsections.text_content:
TRELOCprep
-	Specifies the maximum time for the Handover Preparation procedure in the source eNB.
TX2RELOCoverall
-	Specifies the maximum time for the protection of the overall handover procedure in the source eNB.
TDCprep
-	Specifies the maximum time for the SeNB Addition Preparation, MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation, SgNB Addition Preparation, or MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation procedure in the MeNB.
TDCoverall
-	Specifies the maximum time in the SeNB for either the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure or the protection of the E-UTRAN actions necessary to configure UE resources at SeNB Addition or MeNB initiated SeNB Modification. Or specifies the maximum time in the SgNB for either the SgNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure or the protection of the E-UTRAN actions necessary to configure UE resources at SgNB Addition or MeNB initiated SgNB Modification.

content.title: 10	Handling of unknown, unforeseen and erroneous protocol data
content.description: Section 10 of TS 36.413 [4] is applicable for the purposes of the present document.
